definition: to set off by contrast/antithesis/analogy parallelism (linguistics)
to reflect (light)/to shine/to project (an image onto a screen etc)
(of garments) against the skin/to line/lining/to contrast with/to assist financially

sentences.english: Cover marriage gauze originally luxuriant elegance, the bride of set off is more lovely.
sentences.chinese: 本套婚紗華麗典雅，映襯的新娘更加楚楚動人。

sentences.english: It's more typical and west-like with the American-style furniture inside and outside.
sentences.chinese: 在美式裝修的映襯下，它顯得更加典型，更加西化。

sentences.english: Cylindrical little light more set off the sentiment that Luo Mandi overcomes.
sentences.chinese: 圓柱形小燈更映襯了羅曼蒂克的情調。

sentences.english: Her hair looked very red on the black floor.
sentences.chinese: 在黑色地板的映襯下她的頭髮顯得越發紅豔。

sentences.english: The  Chinese flowering crabapple looks still even  more  charming against  the  green leaves.
sentences.chinese: 在綠葉的映襯下，海棠花顯得更加嬌豔。

sentences.english: Diamonds look best when they are set against black cloth.
sentences.chinese: 鑽石在黑布的映襯下最好看。

sentences.english: They were in silhouette against the blue sky.
sentences.chinese: 藍色的天空映襯出他們黑色的輪廓。

sentences.english: The red house stands out against the background of green hills.
sentences.chinese: 這座紅房子在青山的映襯下十分奪目。

sentences.english: Low hills provide the backdrop as views seawards extend into infinite blue.
sentences.chinese: 在山岡的映襯下，無邊無際的藍天向大海延伸。

sentences.english: The red house stands out against the backgrond of green hills.
sentences.chinese: 這座紅房子在青山的映襯下十分奪目。

sentences.english: The snow-capped mountain stood out in sharp relief against the blue sky .
sentences.chinese: 冰雪覆蓋的高山在藍天的映襯下格外醒目。

sentences.english: Bright flowers always stand out well against a large black background.
sentences.chinese: 明亮的花朵在大幅黑色背景映襯下總是非常引人注目。

sentences.english: The white towers look even more sacred, under the blue sky and white cloud.
sentences.chinese: 白塔在藍天白雲的映襯下更爲聖潔奪目。

sentences.english: So blend the turrets and shadows there that all seems pendulous in air .
sentences.chinese: 塔樓陰影交互映襯，一切都似乎高懸空際。

sentences.english: The trunks of the pines projected from the snow that covered all the ground .
sentences.chinese: 松樹幹在鋪滿白雪的大地的映襯下顯得格外清楚。

sentences.english: The red house stands out against the old trees that reach high up to the sky.
sentences.chinese: 這座紅房子在參天古樹的映襯下十分奪目。

definition: all the colors in profusion (idiom); a garish display
to conform (with)/to echo/to correlate well/(linguistics) agreement
(of garments) against the skin/to line/lining/to contrast with/to assist financially
to enhance by contrast/to set off/to serve as a background in order to bring out the subject with greater brilliance/to serve as a prop/a foil
to pervade/to fill the air/diffuse/everywhere present/about to inundate (water)/permeated by (smoke)/filled with (dust)/to saturate (the air with fog, smoke etc)
